DatapointDescription: "E.g. Holding Company, Primary Nonferrous Metal Producer"
"E.g. Nonferrous Metal (except Aluminum) Smelting and Refining"

"A D U N S number is a free nine digit identifier issued by Dun and Bradstreet to identify a specific business entity at a specific location worldwide
It is not required by law and it does not create a companys legal existence
A company may have multiple D U N S numbers for subsidiaries branches or locations
The number itself is not confidential and is meant to be shared
Companies do not pay to receive a D U N S number but data products built on it often cost money
D U N S numbers are widely used by financial data providers governments banks procurement platforms and technology companies
They act as a stable global reference key to organize company data and corporate hierarchies
They are sometimes compared to a social security number for a company but the comparison is only loosely accurate"

This is not a well-defined metric, but with the Valueline tool, they use a letter grading system in their company financial health analysis (e.g. B+) which could be useful when glancing at a public company, or writing an overview.
